text:
I don’t understand how MS didn’t realize ahead of time that this update in its
current form was doomed to fail on the broad majority of systems. A stock
Windows installation only creates a recovery partition with about ~100 MB of
free space. Some enterprises that went way above and beyond Microsoft’s
published partition recommendations and used a larger size like 1 GB during
imaging would be OK, but that has got to be a very small subset of machines. 
This update absolutely needed to do the resizing automatically, assuming the
recovery partition is in the proper position to be able to shrink the OS
partition to make room.
